com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface DirectoryService2

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface DirectoryService2
extends Service

A Directory Service that provides agents with access to config and state directories for use during runtime.

Since:
5.5.5.2

Method Summary
 java.io.File getAgentHome()
          The Agent Home directory is the directory where the Agent Package was deployed and contains runtime libraries, binaries and scripts that are accessed during the lifetime of an agent.
 java.io.File getScratchFile(java.lang.String name, boolean overwriteExisting, boolean makeAgentInstanceUnique)
          Loads a file that was deployed in the AgentHome directory and copies it to the Agent's state dir.
 java.io.File getStateHome()
          The State Home directory where an Agent may read and write runtime files.
 

Method Detail

getAgentHome

java.io.File getAgentHome()
The Agent Home directory is the directory where the Agent Package was deployed and contains runtime libraries, binaries and scripts that are accessed during the lifetime of an agent. Should be consider as read-only access to the agents package deployment directory

Returns:
File for the agents package deployment directory

getScratchFile

java.io.File getScratchFile(java.lang.String name,
                            boolean overwriteExisting,
                            boolean makeAgentInstanceUnique)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Loads a file that was deployed in the AgentHome directory and copies it to the Agent's state dir. This will permit an Agent to make changes and persist the deployed file to its read/write state location

Parameters:
name - The relative filename of the file
overwriteExisting - Ignores an existing file in the state directory and will reload from Agent home
makeAgentInstanceUnique - Creates the scratch file with the agent-type/agent-name sub-directory. This is useful if the scratch file being created is modified on a per agent basis
Returns:
a read/write handle from the state directory of the requested file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the scratch file cannot be returned

getStateHome

java.io.File getStateHome()
The State Home directory where an Agent may read and write runtime files.

Returns:
File for the agents assigned state directory
